subtitleNullable: images and metadata scraped from Reddit, then classified using image recognition
descriptionNullable:
**Disclaimer**: These memes were collected by a blind web scrape, the vast majority of them I have not looked at; I do not endorse any sentiments expressed in them. 

### Context
This data contains ~50 examples from each of the 115 of the most common memes posted to Reddit during 2018.  This dataset is a subset of a larger set of Reddit memes collected over the course of 1 year by scraping posts from dozens of meme orientated Subreddits. [Using an image recognition methodology dubbed "Meme Vision"](https://towardsdatascience.com/meme-vision-framework-e90a9a7a4187) the images were then labelled into ~1000 different classifications (i.e. 1 classification = 1 type of meme). 

### Content
5716 image, consisting of ~50 examples from each of 115 meme types. Organised into folders, with a 20/80 train/validation split. Also metadata including the original link, score, number of comments etc for (nearly) all of the images. Note that sometimes exactly the same image appears twice - this is because it was posted to two different Subreddits. 

### Acknowledgements
Web scraping implemented using [Python Reddit API Wrapper developed by Bryce Boe](https://praw.readthedocs.io/en/latest/), which in turn uses the [Reddit API](https://www.reddit.com/dev/api). Web scraping also implemented using [Imgur Python API](https://github.com/Imgur/imgurpython) which in turn uses the [Imgur API](https://api.imgur.com/). Collection & storage was facilitated using [AWS infrastructure](https://aws.amazon.com). 

### Copyright 
Copyright of all images retained by respective owners. All images posted to Reddit under fair use.
